details:
Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the Ruby 1.9 interpretor.


* [CVE-2017-0898](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-0898)
Buffer underrun vulnerability in Kernel.sprintf
* [CVE-2017-0899](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-0899)
ANSI escape sequence vulnerability
* [CVE-2017-0900](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-0900)
DOS vulernerability in the query command
* [CVE-2017-0901](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-0901)
gem installer allows a malicious gem to overwrite arbitrary files
* [CVE-2017-10784](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-10784)
Escape sequence injection vulnerability in the Basic
 authentication of WEBrick
* [CVE-2017-14033](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14033)
Buffer underrun vulnerability in OpenSSL ASN1 decode
* [CVE-2017-14064](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14064)
Heap exposure vulnerability in generating JSON


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
1.9.3.194-8.1+deb7u6.


We recommend that you upgrade your ruby1.9.1 packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
